file_content.text: You wanted to meet.
Heskal....
I don't leave Zakuul for just anyone. Be honored.
You followed me.
I was invited. Heskal arranged all of this. The fool.
You murdered his people. He'd never help you.
You're lying. He hated you.
He believed his destiny was to betray you.
If you wanted a fight, we wouldn't be talking.
Tell me what you want.
I have the imagination to see many solutions to a dilemma. Unlike your friend.
I never trusted Heskal, but he did me a favor. Now I get to end you.
I'm going to kill you.
Don't be so sure you know how things end.
Scions have always worshipped at the false altar of fate. That is why I kill them. I am beyond prophecy.
I forge my own destiny by making the hard choices. Now it's your turn.
You want to make a deal.
I'm not without mercy. Surrender. You will be returned to carbonite until I find a way to rid you of my father.
And the others? Lana and Koth?
Free to leave. Without the Gravestone, of course. It belongs to the Eternal Throne. You understand.
Fear the snake who believes himself a dragon. My son will betray you.
I'm a busy man. Don't make me wait.
I want to avoid further bloodshed--and free some head space. I'll have my people stand down, with your permission.
[Lie] I surrender.
Certainly.
Lana? It's me.
That was fast--
Arcann's here! Defend the ship!
Idiot.
Wouldn't dream of it.
[Attack Arcann]
Come.
I'll surrender to save my friends. But they'll only stand down if I tell them to.
I accept your terms, Arcann.
I respect loyalty. Proceed.
Lana? Are you there?
I didn't expect to hear from you so soon.
The Gravestone is surrounded, Lana. Surrender the ship. Arcann promises you can all go free. Don't fight him.
Whoever you really are... my ally wouldn't surrender for anything. But thank you for the warning.
I do not know what I hate more... cowardice, or incompetence.
You will never be rid of me, Arcann. Not until you kill the Outlander.
Have it your way, Father.
[Lie] I surrender.
I want to avoid further bloodshed--and regain my freedom. I'll tell my followers to stand down, with your permission.
Waste their lives if you wish.
